title: Man City boss Pep Guardiola confirms Vincent Kompany is out of Champions League game against Monaco
text:
Man City boss Pep Guardiola confirms Vincent Kompany is out of Champions League game against Monaco The Spaniard revealed the Belgian centre-back will be missing through injury for the last 16 tie Share Pep Guardiola will be without his captain Vincent Kompany again (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) Share Get   Thank you for subscribing!   
Manchester City boss Pep Guardiola has confirmed Vincent Kompany is out of the last 16 Champions League tie against Monaco. 
The Belgian centre-back has been struggling with a knee injury and played just one game - against Crystal Palace in the FA Cup - since injuring himself in the Premier League against the same opposition last November. 
And Guardiola bemoaned his captain's absence, but had positive news about a return. 
"Kompany is not ready for tomorrow," Guardiola admitted. "I think it wonâ€™t be longer. The Huddersfield game he will be ready." Willy Caballero will be hoping to keep Claudio Bravo on the sidelines (Photo: REUTERS) 
Another headache for the Spanish coach is surrounding his goalkeeper for the game at the Etihad. 
Claudio Bravo has been in disastrous form in his debut campaign for the Citizens, with Willy Caballero deputising in recent weeks, but Guardiola would not divulge which will be given the nod for Tuesday. 
"Tomorrow we are going to decide," said Guardiola when pressed on the issue. Video Loading Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now
